page.title: 11RELIGION AND FORD CHURCH
page.content: There are two churches in our block.St. Michael's in FORD and another in MONTFORD. In the 12th century Ford Chapel first originated as a gift from the Crown, and was dependent on the Chapel of St. Michael's in Shrewsbury Castle.In 1410 Ford Chapel was endowed to Battlefield College,this was until the latters dissolution in 1548.The Crown took control again and sold the benefice in 1590.After this time it passed through many hands until in 1927 when the Bishop of Hereford took control.The registers are complete from 1589. Until 1417 the church was served by chaplains of St. Michael in the Castle.Many priests have served since then.The Rev. Robert Sharp took over in 1977.
